definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :1Ki 10:10 spice, balsam, balsam-tree (Ar. ba4, Aram. [[בּוּסְמָא]], besmo0, Gk. ba/lsamon; cf. Löw:53)—´[[ב]] Is 3:24 +, [[בֶּ֫שֶׂם]] Ex 30:23 v. infr., [[בְּשָׂמִי]] Ct So 5:1 (as if fr. [[בָּשָׂם]]); pl. [[בְּשָׂמִים]] Ex 25:6 + 18 t., [[בְּשָׂמָיו]] Ct So 4:16; —

spice, perfume, sweet odour Is 3:24; [[קִנְּמָן־בֶּשֶׂם]] Ex 30:23 (´[[ב]] perh. so pointed to distinguish it from) [[קְנֵה־בשֶׁׂם]] v:Ex 30:23; —with this cf. Aram. qny0 dbsm0a , [[קני בוסמא]]—spices as costly, token of wealth 2Ki 20:13 = Is 39:9 cf. 2Ch 32:27; royal gifts 1Ki 10:2, 1Ki 10:10, 1Ki 10:25 = 2Ch 9:1, 2Ch 9:19, 2Ch 9:24, cf. sg. 1Ki 10:10 = 2Ch 9:9; as article of commerce Ez Eze 27:22; burnt at burial 2Ch 16:14; appointed for ingredient of the anointing oil Ex 25:6, Ex 35:8 cf. v:Ex 25:28 (all P), cf. 1Ch 9:30 (Palm. v. supr.); stored in temple 1Ch 9:29; used for purifying the women of Ahasuerus Es 2:12; elsewhere only Ct So 4:10, So 4:14 spices, v:So 4:16 balsam-juice, gathered Ct So 5:1; balsam-tree ´[[הָרֵי ב]] Ct So 8:14; beds of balsam ´[[עֲרֻגוֹת בּ]] Ct So 6:2; cf. ´[[עֲרֻוּגַת בּ]] Ct So 5:13 sim. of lover's cheeks.
